seo_title: European Stocks Rise (Excluding France), PMI Hits 17-Mont...
seo_description: European markets mostly advanced, with Stoxx 600, FTSE 100, and DAX 40 posting gains. France's CAC 40 was flat. Eurozone PMI hit a 17-month high, UK retail s...
tldr: The benchmark Stoxx Europe 600 index rose by 0.23% to 575.76 points, with most major European stock markets closing higher.
The UK's FTSE 100, Germany's DAX 40, and Italy's FTSE MIB 30 all recorded gains, while France's CAC 40 index remained unchanged.
The Eurozone's Composite PMI reached a 17-month high of 52.2 in October, and UK retail sales exceeded expectations with a 0.5% increase in September.
content_md:
# European Markets Mostly Up; France Flat as Key Economic Indicators Surge

European stock markets largely closed higher on Tuesday, with the benchmark Stoxx Europe 600 index gaining 0.23% to reach 575.76 points. This positive trend was observed across most major bourses, though France's CAC 40 index bucked the trend by closing flat.

In the United Kingdom, the FTSE 100 index saw a significant rise of 0.7%, closing at 9,645.62 points. Germany's DAX 40 index also posted gains, increasing by 0.13% to finish at 24,239.89 points. Italy's FTSE MIB 30 index contributed to the positive sentiment, climbing 0.25% to 42,486.67 points. Meanwhile, the French CAC 40 index ended the day unchanged at 8,225.63 points.

Economic indicators provided further impetus, painting a generally optimistic picture for the Eurozone and the UK. The Euro/Dollar parity was trading slightly higher, up 0.05% at 1.162.

Crucially, the Eurozone's Composite Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 52.2 in October from 51.2 in September. This marks the highest level for the Composite PMI in 17 months, signalling robust business activity. Separately, in the UK, retail sales in September exceeded expectations, increasing by 0.5%.
